title: Spotify and Apple Music Ban All AI-Generated Tracks in 2025
shortdescription: Major platforms crack down on AI music flooding charts with fake artists and streams.
author: Dana Kim

content.content: /images/Spotify and Apple Music Ban All AI-Generated Tracks in 2025.webp
The Great AI Purge Has Begun

In a historic joint announcement, Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube Music, and Deezer confirmed that starting January 1, 2025, all tracks identified as 100% AI-generated by non-human creators will be permanently removed from their platforms.
The move comes after thousands of fake AI artists flooded global charts in 2024–2025, racking up billions of fraudulent streams and pushing legitimate human artists out of Top 50 positions.

New AI-detection algorithms (developed with help from OpenAI’s former safety team) can now identify synthetic vocals, instrumentation, and metadata patterns with 99.7% accuracy. Any track without verified human creative input will be flagged and removed within 24 hours.
Artists using AI as a tool (e.g., for mastering or background textures) are safe — but fully AI-created “ghost artists” with zero human involvement are officially banned.

Billie Eilish, Nicki Minaj, and ABBA’s Björn Ulvaeus publicly applauded the decision, while some AI startups called it “creative censorship.” Regardless, the message is clear: 2025 will be the year streaming platforms chose human artistry over algorithms.
